body_html:
Still getting this issue when compiled with 'dbg' option. Any workaround?

My workaround/hack has been to change make_wheelfile_inner of '/python2.7/dist-packages/wheel/archive.py' to add allowZip64=True parameter to zipfile.ZipFile class as:

zip = zipfile.ZipFile(open(zip_filename, "wb+"), "w", compression=zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED, _allowZip64=True_)
body_text:
Still getting this issue when compiled with 'dbg' option. Any workaround?
My workaround/hack has been to change make_wheelfile_inner of '/python2.7/dist-packages/wheel/archive.py' to add allowZip64=True parameter to zipfile.ZipFile class as:
zip = zipfile.ZipFile(open(zip_filename, "wb+"), "w",                         compression=zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED, _allowZip64=True_)
body:
Still getting this issue when compiled with 'dbg' option. Any workaround?

My workaround/hack has been to change `make_wheelfile_inner` of '/python2.7/dist-packages/wheel/archive.py' to add `allowZip64=True` parameter to `zipfile.ZipFile` class as:

`
zip = zipfile.ZipFile(open(zip_filename, "wb+"), "w",                        
                          compression=zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED, _allowZip64=True_) 
`
